subject: Personal Finance
title: How Scarcity Hijacks Your Brain
description: A quick, practical guide to How Scarcity Hijacks Your Brain.

hook.text: When money is tight, your brain physically changes how it processes decisions.

buildup.text: Mullainathan found that scarcity consumes mental bandwidth like apps draining a phone battery.

discovery.text: Financial stress lowers IQ performance by about 13 points ‚Äî like losing a night of sleep.

twist.text: It's not that poor decisions cause poverty. Poverty impairs the decision process itself.

climax.text: The brain prioritizes immediate survival over long-term planning when resources feel scarce.

punchline.text: Scarcity taxes the mind, not just the wallet.
